metadata.title: CVE-2023-39194 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Undergoing Certification (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the XFRM subsystem in the Linux kernel. The specificflaw exists within the processing of state filters, which can result in aread past the end of an allocated buffer. This flaw allows a localprivileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read,potentially leading to an information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic-64k - 5.15.0-91.101
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
